sources.title: Hold that Woman
sources.description: A skip-tracer doesn't realize that the radio he is trying to repossess contains stolen diamonds.

sources.title: Hold That Woman! (1940) COMEDY
sources.description:
Stars: James Dunn, Frances Gifford and George Douglas
Director: Sam Newfield

A skip tracer--someone who collects late payments from people who've purchased appliances, etc., or takes them back them when they don't pay--repossesses a small radio from a deadbeat who's skipped payments. What he doesn't know is that a gang that has stolen diamonds from a Hollywood movie star has stashed them inside the radio, and they start hunting for him.

sources.title: Hold That Woman! (1940) Comedy, Crime, Romance B movie
sources.description:
A Laff-Drama of Budgets and Bill Collectors!
A skip tracer (repo man) repossesses a small radio from a deadbeat who's skipped payments. What he doesn't know is that a gang that has stolen diamonds from a Hollywood movie star has stashed them inside the radio!

Director: Sam Newfield 
Writers: George Bricker, William A. Pierce 
Stars: James Dunn, Frances Gifford, George Douglas
Genres: B movie, Comedy, Crime, Romance
